result.execSummary:
All charges against John Wesley Collins in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John Wesley Collins is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Wesley Collins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Wesley Collins in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for John Wesley Collins.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Jury Trial.  State's witness is not available and the State is unable to proceed. Defense moves to dismiss the case. Court ordered case dismissed.

Defendant John Wesley Collins appeared by video.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for John Wesley Collins.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 9-19-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Defendant John Wesley Collins in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 9-13-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 9-19-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John Wesley Collins in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Attorney Ritter is requesting more time to meet with her client.  Case is adjourned to 8-18-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Wesley Collins in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Wesley Collins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Status Conference held.  Defendant appears in Court without counsel.  Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation. Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court appoints Attorney Allison Ritter who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $100.00/month beginning upon completion of the case and every month thereafter until paid in full.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 10.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John Wesley Collins in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.   Defendant appears in Court without counsel.  Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation. Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court will appoint an attorney at next court date and shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $100.00/month beginning upon completion of the case and every month thereafter until paid in full.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AS.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to the remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant John Wesley Collins in court.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
